meanings.sent1: She accidentally overcured the cookies, making them too hard to eat.
meanings.sent2: The baker learned to be careful with the oven temperature to avoid overcuring the pastries.
meanings.sent3: The overcuring of the paint caused it to crack and peel, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: His relentless pursuit of perfection led to overcuring every dish he cooked, resulting in disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The sun overcuring the clay made it impossible to mold into the desired shape.

meanings.definition: The act of curing too much.
meanings.sent1: The overcuring of the meat made it tough and unappetizing.
meanings.sent2: Overcuring can sometimes be more harmful than undercuring in food preservation.
meanings.sent3: The overcuring of the glue caused it to dry too quickly, sticking his fingers together.
meanings.sent4: The overcuring of the concrete made it stronger but less flexible, impacting its durability.
meanings.sent5: The overcuring of the leather resulted in a stiff and uncomfortable jacket.
